messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/CommentController.php`, I found that `App\\Http\\Controllers\\Api\\V1\\CommentController@index` is implemented to process HTTP requests. To determine the full path with the correct prefix and the acceptable HTTP methods, I found the necessary information in other files.

I'll provide you with the contents of all related files, and your task is to determine and output:

- The full HTTP request path for the endpoint, which must begin with a forward slash (/) and have path parameters wrapped in curly braces ({}).
- Whether all HTTP methods are acceptable, this will override the results for other HTTP methods.
- Whether the HEAD method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the POST method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the OPTIONS method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the TRACE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the GET method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PUT method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the DELETE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PATCH method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.

You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

message.content:
Full HTTP request path:
- /v1/comments

Acceptable methods:
- all methods acceptable: false
- HEAD: true
- POST: false
- OPTIONS: false
- TRACE: false
- GET: true
- PUT: false
- DELETE: false
- PATCH: false

Explanation:
- routes/api.php defines a route group with prefix('v1'), so all API routes under that group are rooted at /v1.
- Inside that group there is Route::apiResource('comments', CommentController::class)->only(['index', 'show']);. The resource name "comments" maps the index action to the path /v1/comments (and the show action to /v1/comments/{comment}, but index is the implemented method in App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1\CommentController@index).
- apiResource(...)->only(['index','show']) registers only the index (list) and show (single item) resource routes, so only the GET-based routes are created for this resource in the application routing configuration.
- GET is therefore acceptable for /v1/comments (index). HEAD is considered acceptable because a GET route implies the ability to retrieve headers via HEAD (the framework will handle HEAD requests for GET routes). The other methods (POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE) are not registered for this path and thus are not acceptable based on the code. OPTIONS and TRACE are not defined by the route declaration; they are not registered in code for this endpoint (OPTIONS responses may be produced by infrastructure/CORS handling, but they are not explicitly defined in the application routing), so they are reported as false here.
